Package org.apache.arrow.adbc.core

package org.apache.arrow.adbc.core
ADBC (Arrow Database Connectivity) is an API standard for Arrow-based database access.

An Arrow-based interface between applications and database drivers. ADBC aims to provide a vendor-independent API for SQL and Substrait-based database access that is targeted at analytics/OLAP use cases.

This API is intended to be implemented directly by drivers and used directly by client applications. To assist portability between different vendors, a "driver manager" library is also provided, which implements this same API, but dynamically loads drivers internally and forwards calls appropriately.

Version:
1.0.0
  • Class
    Description
    AdbcConnection
    A connection to a AdbcDatabase.
    AdbcConnection.GetObjectsDepth
    The level of nesting to retrieve for AdbcConnection.getObjects(GetObjectsDepth, String, String, String, String[], String).
    AdbcDatabase
    An instance of a database (e.g. a handle to an in-memory database).
    AdbcDriver
    A handle to an ADBC database driver.
    AdbcException
    An error in the database or ADBC driver.
    AdbcInfoCode
    Integer IDs used for requesting information about the database/driver.
    AdbcOptions
    An ADBC object that supports getting/setting generic options.
    AdbcStatement
    A container for all state needed to execute a database query, such as the query itself, parameters for prepared statements, driver parameters, etc.
    AdbcStatement.PartitionResult
    The partitions of a result set.
    AdbcStatement.QueryResult
    The result of executing a query with a result set.
    AdbcStatement.UpdateResult
    The result of executing a query without a result set.
    AdbcStatusCode
    A status code indicating the general category of error that occurred.
    BulkIngestMode
    How to handle already-existing/nonexistent tables for bulk ingest operations.
    ErrorDetail
    Additional details (not necessarily human-readable) contained in an AdbcException.
    IsolationLevel
    The isolation level to use for transactions when autocommit is disabled.
    PartitionDescriptor
    An opaque descriptor for a part of a potentially distributed or partitioned result set.
    StandardSchemas
     
    StandardStatistics
    Definitions of standard statistic names/keys.
    TypedKey<T>
    A typesafe option key.
